definition: (not of regular commerce) to sell or dispose of (goods etc)/to get rid of/to unload
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Avoid  alternative investments and private partnerships that might be hard to sell.
sentences.chinese: 不要做可能難於脫手的另類投資或私人合夥投資。

sentences.english: You need to catch the right wave at the right time and know when to get off.
sentences.chinese: 你需要在正確時間把握正確趨勢，並且知道何時脫手。

sentences.english: The injury effectively rules out any plans United may have had of selling Anderson in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 這個傷病讓曼聯無法在夏季將安德森脫手。

sentences.english: The wicket-keeper fumbled the ball and dropped it.
sentences.chinese: 那個守門員居然笨手笨腳地脫手失掉了球。

sentences.english: If you stand up and get rid of is to add penalty time.
sentences.chinese: 如果站起來和脫手是要加罰時間的。

sentences.english: It feels it's easy to be out of hand when wielding forcibly ?
sentences.chinese: 感覺好像用力揮動會很容易脫手飛出去？

definition: a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
